units.title: Induction of primitive streak with CHIR99021
units.text: Differentiation is commenced 24 h post-seeding by exposing the iPSCs to TeSR-E6 containing 6 µM CHIR99021 followed by 200 ng/mL FGF9 for 5 and 2 d, respectively, inducing posterior intermediate mesoderm and metanephric mesenchyme (Steps 25–28).
units.rationale: This step describes the precise reagent concentrations and timing for initiating differentiation toward intermediate mesoderm, a critical procedural action.

units.title: Maintenance of metanephric mesenchyme with CDBLY2
units.text: Further specification and support of the metanephric mesenchyme population occurs from day 8 to 13 of differentiation (Step 29) through the addition of nephron progenitor maintenance medium, adapted from a previous method11 to increase BMP7 levels6.
units.rationale: This specifies the critical window and medium composition for sustaining nephron progenitors, a key adaptation in the protocol.

units.title: Cell aggregation and micromass generation
units.text: Organoids are generated at day 13 of differentiation using our standard centrifugation technique9 with TesR-E6 medium10 and are cultured for 14 d (day 27, representing the D13 + 14 timepoint in the original research related to this manuscript6) before collection (Figs. 1 and 2).
units.rationale: This outlines the exact timing and method for transitioning from monolayer to 3D organoid culture, a core procedural step.

units.title: CHIR pulse to induce nephrogenesis
units.text: Following 14 d of culture in TesR-E6 basal medium, with an initial 5 d exposure to FGF9, the resulting PT-enhanced organoids possess more mature PTs... A unique feature... is the addition of 6 µM CHIR99021 for 1 h after micromass plating to induce nephrogenesis.
units.rationale: This describes the specific CHIR99021 pulse protocol applied post-aggregation to trigger nephron formation, a defining procedural step.

units.title: Albumin uptake assay for megalin/cubilin activity
units.text: Add 4 µL of TRITC–albumin to 4 mL of E6 within ‘test’ conical tube (1:1,000 dilution)... Incubate the organoids overnight (~16–20 h) in a 37 °C incubator... Image immediately using a confocal microscope with a 594 nm laser...
units.rationale: This provides the exact reagent dilution, incubation duration, and imaging parameters for a functional assay critical to validating PT maturation.

units.title: DAPI uptake assay for organic cation transport
units.text: Add 4 µL of DAPI to ‘substrate’ and ‘substrate + inhibitor’ tubes containing 4 mL of E6 (1:1,000 dilution)... Add 4 μL of 100 mM cimetidine to ‘inhibitor’ and ‘substrate + inhibitor’ tubes... Incubate the organoids for 1 h in a 37 °C incubator... Image immediately using a confocal microscope with 405 and 640 nm lasers...
units.rationale: This details the precise conditions for assessing MATE transporter function using DAPI as a substrate, a key functional validation step.

units.title: Wholemount immunofluorescence fixation and staining
units.text: Aspirate medium from the base of the transwell and replace with 1 mL per well of cold 4% PFA, also adding one drop of PFA on top of each organoid. Incubate the plate for 30 min at 4 °C... Replace the PBS with 200 µL per well of blocking solution and incubate on a rocking platform at 4 °C for 3–5 h... Add 150 µL of primary antibody solution to each well... Incubate the plate overnight (~16 h) on a rocking platform at 4 °C...
units.rationale: This captures the full fixation, blocking, and primary antibody incubation protocol for immunofluorescence, essential for phenotypic analysis.

units.title: Transwell-based organoid culture and medium changes
units.text: Transfer the cell micromasses to a Transwell membrane for air–medium interface culture in a 3D format... Following 14 d of culture in TesR-E6 basal medium, with an initial 5 d exposure to FGF9...
units.rationale: This defines the culture format and temporal medium regimen critical for organoid maturation and PT patterning.

units.title: Cell dissociation and micromass preparation
units.text: Gently detach the cells from the well surface by pipetting up and down a maximum of six times using a P1000 pipette, dissociating to a single-cell suspension... Top-up the conical tube volume to 5 mL with E6/2% FBS and centrifuge the tube at 300g for 3 min... Resuspend the cell pellet to a final volume of 2 mL of E6/2% FBS final volume... Remove 10 µL of the cell suspension for counting with a hemocytometer.
units.rationale: This details the critical dissociation, centrifugation, and resuspension steps for generating uniform micromasses prior to Transwell plating.

units.title: CDBLY2 medium preparation and handling
units.text: Referring to Table 3, calculate the total volume of CDBLY2 required for the experiment and for each of the five medium changes (daily from D8 to D12 of differentiation), allowing 1 mL per well of a 12-well plate and an additional 0.5–1 mL medium for pipetting errors. Collect and thaw all required reagents detailed in Table 3 on ice. Working on ice in a biological safety cabinet, make up the total volume of CDBLY2 medium required for the entire experiment in a 50 mL Falcon tube, adding the exact volume of each reagent to cold media. Invert the tube to mix, then aliquot into five individual conical tubes for each medium change and refrigerate. Before each medium change, warm the tube to room temperature.
units.rationale: This provides the exact, stepwise protocol for preparing and handling the complex CDBLY2 medium, a defining and sensitive procedural element.
